rows: Sri Lanka Ambassador- designate to People’s Republic of China formally assumes duties
Dr. Palitha T. B. Kohona, the Ambassador-designate of Sri Lanka to China, officially began his duties on December 30, 2020, at the Sri Lankan Embassy in Beijing.
The Embassy launches a new website: www.bangkok.embassy.gov.lk

The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Bangkok has launched its new official website, www.bangkok.embassy.gov.lk. The revamped site offers user-friendly access to a wide range of information on Sri Lanka and the Embassy. Visit the website for .
Ambassador Aryasinha commends the services rendered by the Maha Sanga in the propagation of Buddhism across the world

Ambassador Ravinatha Aryasinha praised the services provided by the Maha Sanga in the United States and other countries for their role in spreading Buddhism worldwide. He emphasized that they have helped promote the most sacred offerings that Sri Lanka has to offer.
Embassy in Washington DC Organizes Virtual Christmas Celebrations

The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Washington D.C. organized virtual Christmas celebrations on December 22, connecting with the Sri Lankan community in the Greater Washington area. The main program was conducted online, bringing together participants to mark the festive occasion.
Sri Lanka-Oman Joint Technical Committee on Labour and Training meets via video conference

The 4th Technical Committee Meeting under the MoU in the Field of Labour and Training between Sri Lanka and Oman took place on 23 December 2020 via video conference. The Sri Lankan delegation was represented by Add, discussing collaboration in labor and training initiatives.
Christmas blessings organised by the Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Frankfurt am main

The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Frankfurt am Main organized a Christmas Blessings event via Zoom on December 21, 2020. Father Christian Enke from St. Leonhard’s Church conveyed his blessings during the event.
Ambassador Prof. M.D. Lamawansa presents Credentials to the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Uzbekistan

Ambassador Prof. M.D. Lamawansa, serving as Sri Lanka's Ambassador to Russia and concurrently to Uzbekistan, presented his credentials to the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Uzbekistan. This formalized his role as Sri Lanka's representative to Uzbekistan.
Permanent Representative Majintha Jayesinghe Presents Credentials to the UNIDO

Ambassador Majintha Jayesinghe presented her credentials to Li Yong, the Director General of the United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO), on December 22, 2020, at the Vienna International Centre. This accreditation marks her official representation at UNIDO.
Christmas Celebrations via ZOOM hosted by the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Jordan

The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Jordan hosted a Christmas celebration via ZOOM on December 19, 2020, for Sri Lankan and Jordanian children. The event took place at the Abdul Hameed Shoman Foundation Library in Amman, bringing joy and festive spirit to the participants.
The Launch of Chandanalepa Ayurvedic Products in Lebanon
The Embassy of Sri Lanka, in partnership with Sanjeewaka Ayurvedic Products (Pvt.) Ltd, introduced the Chandanalepa range in Lebanon at Rafik Hariri Hall to boost Sri Lanka-Lebanon trade relations.
Embassy joins virtual meeting on “prospects for cooperation” with the Sri Lankan and Ukrainian business community

The Sri Lanka Embassy in Ankara, in partnership with the Ceylon Chamber of Commerce and the Ukrainian Chamber of Commerce & Industry, organized a virtual meeting on "prospects for cooperation" on December 11, 2020. The meeting aimed to facilitate collaboration between the Sri Lankan and Ukrainian business communities.
Ambassador Ameer Ajwad inaugurates issuance of NOC to combat trafficking of Sri Lankan Female Migrant Workers

Ambassador Ameer Ajwad inaugurated the issuance of No Objection Certificates (NOC) to combat trafficking of Sri Lankan female migrant workers in Oman. This initiative aims to curb irregular and undocumented migration, particularly among domestic workers.
Interactive Seminar in the Republic of Korea (RoK) on augmentation of power and energy sphere of Sri Lanka

An interactive seminar was held in the Republic of Korea (RoK) focusing on enhancing Sri Lanka's power and energy sector. The webinar featured Ambassador Santhush Jeong Woonjin of the RoK, Ambassador Dr. Saj Mendis, and Moderator Mr. Tharindu Amarasekera, organized by the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Seoul. The session aimed to strengthen cooperation and collaboration between the two countries in the energy sphere.
Embassy organized an interactive webinar and business matchmaking on Sri Lankan Spice sector

The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Ankara organized an interactive webinar and business matchmaking event focusing on the Sri Lankan spice sector in collaboration with the Sri Lanka Export Development Board and the Turkey-Sri Lanka Business Council. The event aimed to facilitate information sharing and networking opportunities for businesses interested in the spice industry.
Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Shanghai together with the Sri Lankan community and Chinese Business Community spread the message of generosity and care during the festive season

The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Shanghai, along with the Sri Lankan and Chinese business communities, promoted generosity and care during the festive season. The initiative aimed to spread a message of goodwill and unity among the communities.
The Ambassador – designate to People’s Republic of China assumes duties
Dr. Palitha Kohona, the Ambassador-designate of Sri Lanka to China, arrived in China on December 15, 2020, and virtually assumed duties on December 16, 2020.

The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Sydney organized a Business Networking Meeting on December 9, 2020, bringing together selected Australian and Sri Lankan businessmen as Covid-19 restrictions eased in Sydney and Australia. The event aimed to foster connections and collaboration between the two business communities.
Ambassador Aryasinha calls on OSLs in the US to support economic promotion and strengthen advocacy of Sri Lanka

Ambassador Ravinatha Aryasinha urged Overseas Sri Lankans (OSLs) in the US to support economic promotion and advocate for Sri Lanka. He emphasized the importance of engaging with the US Government and State bodies to strengthen ties.
High Commissioner of Sri Lanka Professor Sudharshan Seneviratne presents Credentials

Sri Lanka's High Commissioner to Bangladesh, Professor Sudharshan Seneviratne, presented his Letter of Credence to Bangladesh's President Md. Abdul Hamid on December 3, 2020, at the Presidential Palace in Dhaka. This formal ceremony marks the official beginning of Professor Seneviratne's diplomatic tenure in Bangladesh.
Repatriation of 272 stranded Sri Lankans in Malaysia due to the Pandemic Situation

The High Commission of Sri Lanka in Malaysia, along with the Foreign Ministry, the Presidential Secretariat, and Sri Lankan Airlines, successfully repatriated 272 stranded Sri Lankans from Malaysia due to the pandemic situation. The collaborative effort ensured the safe return of these individuals to their home country.
High Commissioner – designate to South Africa Sirisena Amarasekara presents Open Copy of his Letter of Credence to the Deputy Chief of State Protocol Ebrahim Edries

Sirisena Amarasekara, the High Commissioner-designate of Sri Lanka to South Africa, presented the Open Copy of his Letter of Credence to Deputy Chief of State Protocol Ebrahim Edries on December 9th. This formal presentation signifies the beginning of his official diplomatic role in South Africa.
Embassy of Sri Lanka participates in International Food Festival 2020

The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Ha Noi, Viet Nam took part in the 2020 International Food Festival organized by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Viet Nam on December 6. The event was held in Ha Noi, showcasing a variety of international cuisines.
High Commissioner-designate of Sri Lanka to South Africa assumes duties

Sirisena Amarasekara, the High Commissioner-designate of Sri Lanka to South Africa, began his duties at the Sri Lankan High Commission in Pretoria on December 3, 2020. He was warmly welcomed by the staff.
Donation of Test Kits for COVID-19 by SK Group of the Republic of Korea
The SK Group of the Republic of Korea donated COVID-19 test kits to Sri Lanka. Vice President Mr. Hyeonseo Ku posed with Ambassador Dr. A. Saj U. Mendis at the Press Briefing Ceremony.
Ambassador Aryasinha assumes duties in Washington D.C.

Ambassador Ravinatha P. Aryasinha assumed his duties as Sri Lanka’s Ambassador to the United States on December 4, 2020, after the US State Department accepted his credentials. The ceremony adhered to COVID protocols.
High Commissioner Veluppillai Kananathan presented his Letter of Credence appointing him as High Commissioner to Kenya to President Uhuru Muigai Kenyatta on December 2, 2021.
Tourism Promotional interactive webinar held in Canberra

A virtual eco-tourism promotional event titled 'Breathtaking Birds of the Sri Lankan Rainforest' was held in Canberra on November 12, 2020. The interactive webinar showcased the diverse bird species in Sinh, providing insights into Sri Lanka's natural beauty.
Ambassador Ameer Ajwad calls on the Chairman of the State Council of Oman
Ambassador Ameer Ajwad of Sri Lanka visited Chairman Shaikh Abdulmalik bin Abdullah bin Ali al Khalili of the State Council of Oman on November 24 for a courtesy call.
Exploring synergies for convergence in the IT-BPM industry of  Sri Lanka and the Philippines

The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Manila is working to enhance bilateral trade relations with the Philippines in the IT-BPM industry. They are exploring synergies to promote convergence between the two countries in this sector.
Ambassador Prof. M.D. Lamawansa presents credentials to President of the Russian Federation Vladimir Putin at the Kremlin

Ambassador of Sri Lanka to the Russian Federation Prof. M.D. Lamawansa presented his letters of credence to President Vladimir Putin at the Kremlin on 24 November 2020. The ceremony followed tradition and took place in the Alex.
Sustainable Blue-Economy is the Future of Bay of Bengal Region

At a special BIMSTEC event in Bangkok on November 20-21, 2020, Sri Lanka's Ambassador to Thailand, Samantha K. Jayasuriya, emphasized the importance of promoting safety and security in navigation. Sri Lanka advocates for a sustainable blue economy as the future for the Bay of Bengal region.
Ambassador Ameer Ajwad Calls on the new Minister of Higher Education, Scientific Research and Innovation of the Sultanate of Oman

Ambassador Ameer Ajwad of Sri Lanka visited Dr. Rahma bint Ibrahim bi, the new Minister of Higher Education, Scientific Research and Innovation in Oman. The visit was a courtesy call to discuss potential collaborations between the two countries in the field of education and research.
Sri Lanka Embassy in Oman repatriates 291 vulnerable Sri Lankan nationals from Muscat to Colombo

The Sri Lanka Embassy in Oman successfully repatriated 291 vulnerable Sri Lankan nationals from Muscat to Colombo on November 26, 2020, via Sri Lankan Airlines flight UL 206. This effort was carried out in collaboration with the Foreign Ministry.
Sri Lanka’s Ambassador meets with Indonesian Deputy Minister for Production and Marketing

Sri Lanka’s Ambassador to Indonesia and ASEAN, Yasoja Gunasekera, met with the Indonesian Deputy Minister for Production and Marketing, Victoria Simanungkalit, at the Sri Lanka Embassy in Jakarta on 12 November 2020. The meeting aimed to discuss cooperation and strengthen bilateral ties between the two countries.
Sri Lankan nationals successfully evacuated from the war zone in the Tigray region of Ethiopia

The Sri Lanka Embassy in Ethiopia, in coordination with the Foreign Ministry of Sri Lanka and the United Nations in Ethiopia, successfully evacuated thirty-eight (38) Sri Lankan nationals from the war zone in the Tigray region. The safe evacuation was facilitated to ensure the well-being of the Sri Lankan citizens in the conflict-affected area.
Katina pooja at Sri Lanka Maha Vihara in Lumbini organised by Sri Lanka Embassy staff this year
The Katina pooja at the Sri Lanka Maha Vihara in Lumbini was organized on 15 November by the Sri Lanka Embassy staff in Nepal. The event received blessings from the Chief Prelate.
Legatum Prosperity Index highlights the development of education and healthcare sectors in Sri Lanka during the past decade

The 14th Legatum Prosperity Index, released by the London-based think-tank Legatum Institute on November 17, 2020, showcased significant advancements in Sri Lanka's education and healthcare sectors over the past decade.
Sri Lanka Embassy in Moscow advises Sri Lankans not to fall victim to human trafficking

The Sri Lanka Embassy in Moscow warns Sri Lankans to beware of human trafficking scams, as complaints about fake employment and education agencies are increasing. The embassy advises Sri Lankans not to fall victim to these schemes and to be cautious when traveling to Russia.
“Interconnected Business Networking Session” between Sri Lankan and Turkish business community to enhance bilateral trade, tourism and investment

The Embassy organized an "Interconnected Business Networking Session" today (18/11/2020) in collaboration with the Turkish Economic Relations Board (DEIK), Sri Lanka Export Development Board, and Board of Inv to boost bilateral trade, tourism, and investment between the Sri Lankan and Turkish business communities.
Sri Lanka – Oman Food Sector Companies hold B2B webinar to promote Sri Lankan exports of food products

The Sri Lanka Embassy in Oman and Export Development Board collaborated to host a B2B webinar connecting SPAR Oman with 16 Sri Lankan food exporter companies on November 12, 2020. The aim was to promote Sri Lankan food product exports and explore synergies between the companies.
Sri Lankan Mission in Cairo promotes Tourism via Live Virtual Tour on Wildlife

The Sri Lankan Mission in Cairo is promoting tourism by offering a live virtual tour showcasing the country's wildlife and rich flora and fauna. The initiative, called "Go on a Couch Safari," aims to bring Sri Lanka's natural beauty to a global audience through a live streaming program.
Sacred Relics returned to historical Ananda Kuti Vihara by the Sri Lanka Embassy

The Sri Lanka Embassy returned the Sacred Relics of Lord Buddha to the Ananda Kuti Vihara in Kathmandu during a special religious ceremony on 6 November 2020. The relics had been in the embassy's custody since March 2018, marking a significant event for the historical site.
Sri Lanka participation at the China International Import Expo (CIIE)  reaps positive results

Sri Lanka's participation at the China International Import Expo (CIIE) in Shanghai from 5-10 November 2020 yielded positive outcomes, especially in the food sector. The Sri Lanka Pavilion attracted numerous business persons, with support from the Sri Lanka Embassy in China and Consulate.
Ceylon Tea dyed face masks and Ceylon Tea was ceremonially handed over to the Chamber

Ambassador Shani Calyaneratne Karunaratne handed over Ceylon Tea dyed face masks and Ceylon Tea to Mohamed Choucair, Chairman of the Chamber of Commerce, Industry, and Agriculture during bilateral talks. Mohamed Choucair is also the Chairman of Lebanese Economic Organizations.
IT-BPM opportunities in Sri Lanka promoted among the British Sri Lankan community

The Sri Lanka High Commission in London, in partnership with the APSL UK and SLASSCOM, hosted a webinar on promoting IT-BPM opportunities in Sri Lanka among the British Sri Lankan community on the 29th.
Webinar to Explore Opportunities in IT and Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) Sectors

A webinar titled "Sri Lanka: Business Opportunities in IT and Outsourcing" was organized by the Chamber of Commerce (IHK) Frankfurt am Main and the Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Germany. The event, initiated by the Embassy of Sri Lanka, aimed to explore opportunities in the IT and Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) sectors.
Sri Lankan Embassy in Washington D.C. Organizes a Buddha Pooja and Dhamma Sermon  to Observe Vap Poya Day

The Sri Lankan Embassy in Washington D.C. organized a Buddha Pooja and Dhamma Sermon on 30 October 2020 to observe Vap Poya Day, marking the end of the Vas-Rainy Retreat. The event took place at the Embassy premises.
‘Ceylon Tea’ promoted in Australia as an essential immunity booster to fight COVID-19 pandemic

'Ceylon Tea' was promoted in Australia as a key immunity booster to combat the COVID-19 pandemic during a well-attended 'Virtual Ceylon Tea Evening' organized by the Consulate General of Sri Lanka. The event highlighted the significance of tea consumption for boosting immunity during these challenging times.
Katina Ceremony at the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Vienna

The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Vienna conducted a Katina Ceremony on October 26, 2020, featuring heel dana for the Maha Sangha followed by a Pirith Chanting Ceremony. The event took place at the Embassy, where offerings were made to the monks as part of the traditional ceremony.
Ambassador Ameer Ajwad Calls on the Minister of Commerce, Industry and Investment Promotion of Oman

Sri Lanka’s Ambassador to Oman, Ameer Ajwad, met with the new Minister of Commerce, Industry, and Investment Promotion, Qais bin Mohammed Al Yousef, on October 20, 2020. The meeting aimed to strengthen bilateral relations between the two countries.
Sri Lanka-Oman Collaboration in Manufacturing Fibreglass Products Mooted

Sri Lanka Embassy in Oman and the Export Development Board of Sri Lanka (EDB) collaborated to organize a B2B virtual meeting with Al Hilal Fiber & Acrylic Industry LLC, a prominent manufacturer of fiberglass and acrylic products. The meeting aimed to explore potential collaborations in manufacturing fiberglass products between Sri Lanka and Oman.
Promoting the best of Ceylon Cinnamon, Black Pepper and Sri Lankan Spices in Jordan

The Sri Lanka Embassy in Jordan is promoting the best of Ceylon Cinnamon, Black Pepper, and other Sri Lankan spices to highlight the value of these agricultural commodities. This initiative aims to raise awareness about the quality and benefits of Sri Lankan spices in the Jordanian market.
Sri Lanka Appoints An Honorary Consul in Texas, U.S.A.

Sri Lanka's Ambassador to the U.S., Rodney Perera, presented the Commission of Appointment from Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena to Dakshini Se, the newly appointed Honorary Consul in Texas. This appointment strengthens Sri Lanka's representation in the U.S. and enhances diplomatic ties between the two countries.
Sri Lanka Participates at the “e-Connect” online B2B Platform in India

The Sri Lanka Deputy High Commission in Chennai facilitated the participation of Sri Lankan electronic and electrical manufacturers at the "e-Connect" online B2B meetings platform organized by the Indian Electrical and Electronics Manufacturers' Association. Sri Lanka actively engaged with the Indian industry through this virtual platform to enhance business connections and opportunities.
‘Need for social protection has never been greater’ Sri Lanka tells the UNESCAP Committee on Social Development (CSD)

Sri Lanka emphasized the urgent need for social protection during its leadership of the UNESCAP Committee on Social Development. The country was elected as Chair of the sixth session, highlighting the importance of addressing social challenges in the Asia-Pacific region.
Development assistance from Norwegian Investment Fund (Norfund) to Sri Lanka

Norwegian Investment Fund (Norfund) is considering providing development assistance to Sri Lanka following a meeting between Ambassador Godfrey Cooray and CEO Tellef Thorleifsson on October 9, 2020. The discussion aimed to explore opportunities for increased investment and development in the country.
Ceylon Tea Dyed/Branded masks distributed at the “Salon Zen” Exhibition
At the "Salon Zen" Exhibition in Paris from 1 to 5 October 2020, Ceylon Tea Dyed/Branded masks were distributed. The event is known for focusing on personal development and the art of living.
Establishment of Sri Lankan Entrepreneurs Association in Qatar

Sri Lankan importers in Doha have founded the Sri Lankan Entrepreneurs Association in Qatar, which is now affiliated with the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Doha. The Association aims to foster significant growth opportunities for its members in Qatar.
Ambassador of Sri Lanka to the Republic of Cuba Presents Credentials

Ambassador Lakshitha Ratnayake of Sri Lanka presented his credentials to President Miguel Mario Diaz-Canel Bermúdez of Cuba on October 14, 2020, at the Palacio de la Revolución, marking the official start of his diplomatic duties in Cuba.
Consul General Lakshman Hulugalle meets the Governor of New South Wales

Consul General Lakshman Hulugalle met with the Governor of New South Wales, Honourable Margaret Beazley AC QC, on October 13, 2020. During the meeting, he conveyed best wishes from the President and the Prime Minister.
Medical Faculty of University of Peradeniya Collaborates with Moscow City Clinical Hospital

The Medical Faculty of University of Peradeniya collaborated with Moscow City Clinical Hospital in a video-conference to discuss specified areas for further collaboration. The experts exchanged opinions and explored opportunities for partnership.
Webinar on Market Enhancement for Sri Lankan Products and Services in Australia

The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Sydney, in collaboration with the Export Development Board (EDB), hosted a webinar titled "Market Enhancement for Sri Lankan Products and Services in Australia" on October 7, 2020. The objective of the webinar was to promote Sri Lankan products and services in the Australian market, fostering trade relations between the two countries.
Prominent Sri Lankan and Omani Boat Building Companies agrees to collaborate at a B2B webinar
Prominent Sri Lankan and Omani boat building companies collaborated at a successful B2B webinar on October 8, 2020, aiming to promote cooperation between the two countries' boat building industries.
Sri Lanka Ambassador visits Luxembourg Stock Exchange

Sri Lanka Ambassador to Luxembourg, Grace Asirwatham, visited the Luxembourg Stock Exchange on 23 September 2020. During her visit, she met with the Secretary General, Maurice Bauer, to discuss various matters. Head of Relationship Management was also present during the meeting.
Sri Lanka’s  Permanent Representative to  the African Union  Ambassador Sugeeshwara Gunaratna Presents Credentials

Sri Lanka’s Permanent Representative to the African Union, Ambassador Sugeeshwara Gunaratna, presented credentials to the Chairperson of the African Union Commission, His Excellency Moussa Faki Mahamat, on October 6, 2020.
Exploring synergies for bilateral trade with the Philippines

Sri Lankan Ambassador Shobini Gunasekera recently met with Philippine Chamber of Commerce and Industry President Benedicto V. Yujuico on October 1, 2020, to discuss enhancing bilateral trade relations between the two countries. The meeting aimed to explore synergies that could benefit both nations.
Sri Lanka, a Window to Larger Markets of India and EU for Agri Products and Processed food  – Sri Lankan Agripreneurs

Sri Lankan Agripreneurs have launched a program to promote their agricultural products and processed food in the Indian market, aligning with President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's Export Economic Policy. The initiative aims to leverage Sri Lanka's strategic location as a gateway to larger markets in India and the EU. This effort was kicked off with a webinar in Mumbai last week.
Ambassador Asirwatham meets President of European Investment Bank in Luxembourg

Ambassador Asirwatham met with Dr. Werner Ho, the President of the European Investment Bank in Luxembourg, following the recent meeting between the Foreign Ministers of Sri Lanka and Luxembourg in Colombo on January 31, 2020. The meeting aimed to strengthen ties between Sri Lanka and the European Investment Bank.
Sri Lankan Embassy in Washington D.C. Organizes a Buddha Pooja and Dhamma Sermon in view of Adhi Vap Poya Day

The Sri Lankan Embassy in Washington D.C. organized a Buddha Pooja and Dhamma Sermon on October 1, 2020, at the Embassy premises to mark Adhi Vap Poya Day. This event marked the first Dhamma Sermon organized by the Embassy.
Sports and fitness products manufactured with Sri Lankan natural latex rubber get exposure in the Jordan market.

Ambassador Shanika Dissanayake promoted Sri Lankan fitness products made with natural latex rubber in the Jordan market, including those from Textrip (Pvt) Ltd and Elasto Group. This initiative aimed to secure export orders for these companies and enhance commercial engagements between Sri Lanka and Jordan.
Ambassador meets Deputy Minister of Industry and Technology Hasan Buyukdede
Ambassador M. Rizvi Hassen met with Deputy Minister of Industry and Technology Hasan Buyukdede on September 29, 2020. The Ambassador briefed the Deputy Minister on trade matters during the meeting.
Ambassador Ameer Ajwad calls on the new Labour Minister of Oman

Ambassador Ameer Ajwad of Sri Lanka visited the new Minister of Labour of Oman, Prof. Mahad Said bin Ali Baawain, on September 27, 2020, for a courtesy call. The meeting aimed to strengthen diplomatic relations between the two countries.
Sri Lanka calls for a paradigm shift on how tourism and travel is perceived in China

Consul General of Sri Lanka, Manorie Mallikaratchy, emphasized the need for a paradigm shift in how tourism and travel are perceived in China. In a presentation promoting Sri Lanka as a tourist destination, she highlighted the importance of adapting to the new normal era.
Sri Lanka participates in Guangdong 21st Century Maritime Silk Road International Exposition

Sri Lanka took part in the Guangdong 21st Century Maritime Silk Road International Exposition 2020 held from September 24-26 at the Canton Fair complex in Guangzhou. The event was organized by the China Council for the Promotion of International Trade, showcasing maritime trade opportunities.
Mission donates publications on Sri Lanka to the National Library of Turkey
Ambassador M. Rizvi Hassen donated publications about Sri Lanka to the National Library of Turkey during a courtesy call on Director General Hamdi Turşucu of the Ministry of Culture and Tourism.
Meeting between the Suez Canal Authority and  the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Egypt

The Ambassador of Sri Lanka in Egypt, Damayanthie Rajapakse, along with First Secretary (Commercial) Shiwanthi Abeyrathne and Trade Assistant Ahmed Selim, visited the Suez Canal Authority in Egypt to discuss collaboration opportunities. The meeting aimed to strengthen ties between Sri Lanka and Egypt through potential trade partnerships and mutual cooperation.
Ambassador Ameer Ajwad Meets with Dr. Said Al Saqri, new Minister for Economy of the Sultanate of Oman

Ambassador Ameer Ajwad of Sri Lanka met with Dr. Said Al Saqri, the new Minister for Economy of the Sultanate of Oman on September 24, 2020. During the courtesy call, they discussed bilateral relations and cooperation between the two countries.
Webinar on “Market Opportunities and Strategies for Successful Market Entry to Brazil”.

The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Brazil, along with the Export Development Board (EDB) and the Department of Commerce of Sri Lanka, hosted a webinar on "Market Opportunities and Strategies for Successful Market Entry to Brazil" on September 15, 2020. The webinar aimed to provide insights for successful market entry into Brazil.
Sri Lanka participates in 2nd International Forum on Spice Route

Sri Lanka took part in the 2nd International Forum on Spice Route, organized by The Spice Route Foundation and the Ministry of Education and Culture of Indonesia. The forum focused on celebrating diversity and promoting intercultural understanding.
Sri Lanka Embassy finalises certification for export of Sri Lankan Cinnamon  in bark form to Brazilian market

The Sri Lanka Embassy in Brasilia has completed the certification process for exporting Sri Lankan Cinnamon in bark form to the Brazilian market. This allows Sri Lankan exporters to now access the Brazilian market with their cinnamon products.
Permanent Representative Majintha Jayesinghe Presents Credentials to the Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty Organization (CTBTO)

Ambassador Majintha Jayesinghe presented her credentials to Dr. Lassina Zerbo, Executive Secretary of the Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty Organization (CTBTO) on September 10, 2020, at the Vienna International Centre. This formal presentation signifies her official recognition as the Permanent Representative to the CTBTO.
Promotion of Tourism at the China (Guangdong) International Tourism Industry Exposition

The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Guangzhou collaborated with the Sri Lankan Guangdong Sunshine Holiday International Travel Agency Co. LTD to showcase tourism opportunities at the China (Guangdong) International Tourism Industry Exposition (CITIE). This partnership aimed to promote tourism between Sri Lanka and China, enhancing cultural exchange and travel experiences for visitors.
High-profile webinar on economy, business environment, joint ventures and bilateral trade between  Sri Lanka and South Korea

A high-profile webinar on the economy, business environment, joint ventures, and bilateral trade between Sri Lanka and South Korea was organized by the Embassy of Sri Lanka in the Republic of Korea in collaboration with the Ceylon Chamber of Commerce (CCC), Korea Importers Association (KOIMA), and Korea Business Council. The event aimed to facilitate discussions and strengthen economic ties between the two countries.
Official Inauguration of the Honorary Consulate of Sri Lanka in Gdansk, Poland

The Honorary Consulate of Sri Lanka, the only one in Northern Poland, was officially inaugurated on September 11, 2020, in Gdansk. Gdansk, a dynamic commercial city in the Pomera region, now hosts this consulate to strengthen bilateral relations.
Sri Lankan cuisine showcased at “Lulu Food Festival”, Bahrain

Sri Lankan cuisine was highlighted at the "Lulu Food Festival" in Bahrain, organized by Lulu Hypermarket Bahrain, the largest regional hypermarket chain. The festival, held over weekends from August to September 2020 under the theme "Food is Good," featured cuisines from a dozen countries.
Riyadh Chamber of Commerce lists Sri Lankan companies in their new online catalogue

The Riyadh Chamber of Commerce (RCC) has included Sri Lankan companies in their new online catalogue as part of their International Trade Cooperation initiative. This move aims to facilitate business linkages between Sri Lankan and Saudi companies, providing valuable assistance to interested parties.
Temasek Foundation of Singapore donates one million Livinguard face masks to Sri Lanka

Temasek Foundation of Singapore donated one million Livinguard reusable masks to Sri Lanka in support of the country's fight against COVID-19. The masks were presented to Sri Lanka’s High Commissioner to Singapore, Sashikala Pre.

The Embassy and Sri Lanka Tourism Promotion Bureau collaborated to promote the destination at the prestigious Welt Museum in Vienna. The event was attended by a large number of invitees, including representatives from the Diplomatic Corps and Government Institutions. The promotion aimed to showcase Sri Lanka as a desirable travel destination.
Permanent Representative Majintha Jayesinghe Presents Credentials to the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA)

Ambassador Majintha Jayesinghe presented her credentials to Rafael Mariano Grossi, Director General of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) on August 28, 2020, at the Vienna International Centre. This accreditation officially recognizes her as the Permanent Representative to the IAEA.
Permanent Representative Majintha Jayesinghe Presents Credentials United Nations Office in Vienna (UNOV) and UNODC

Ambassador Majintha Jayesinghe presented credentials to Ghada Fathi Waly, Director General of the United Nations Office in Vienna (UNOV), and the Executive Director of the UNODC on behalf of the Secretary-General of the United Nations. This signifies the official recognition of Ambassador Jayesinghe in her role at the UN offices in Vienna.
Ambassador Prof M.D. Lamawansa visits the modern facilities of Kursk State Medical University, the Oncological Hospital and Kursk State University of Russia

Ambassador Prof M.D. Lamawansa visited modern facilities at Kursk State Medical University, the Oncological Hospital, and Kursk State University in Russia. The trip was organized by Sri Lanka’s Honorary Consul in Kursk, Mohamed Chahine, to strengthen ties in political, trade, tourism, culture, and education between the two countries.
Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Russia Prof. M.D. Lamawansa meets the Governor of the Kursk region and a government delegation.

Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Russia Prof. M.D. Lamawansa led a delegation from the Sri Lankan Embassy on their first official visit to Kursk and the Kursk region from August 29 to September 2, 2020. During the visit, they met with the Governor of the Kursk region and other government officials.
Ambassador Dr. Nalin de Silva presented the Letter of Credence

Ambassador Dr. Nalin de Silva presented the Letter of Credence to President Win Myint of Myanmar on September 1, 2020, at the Presidential palace in Nay Pyi Taw. This formal presentation marks the official start of Dr. Nalin de Silva's diplomatic role in Myanmar.
Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Guangzhou participates in 28th Guangzhou Fair

The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Guangzhou took part in the 28th Guangzhou Fair from August 25-31, 2020. The fair was organized by the Guangzhou Municipal People’s Government to showcase and promote Sri Lanka's economy and culture.
Sri Lankan Embassy in Washington D.C. Organizes a Special Event to Unveil the Statue of Lord Buddha and to Venerate the Sacred Jaya Sri Maha Bodhi Tree Sapling at the Embassy Premises

The Sri Lankan Embassy in Washington D.C. held a special event on September 2, 2020, to unveil the statue of Lord Buddha and venerate the sacred Jaya Sri Maha Bodhi Tree Sapling at the Embassy premises.
Ambassador Ameer Ajwad Meets with the newly appointed President of Oman Investment Authority (OIA)

Ambassador Ameer Ajwad of Sri Lanka met with the newly appointed President of Oman Investment Authority (OIA), Abdulsalam Al-Murshidi, on August 31, 2020. They discussed potential bilateral cooperation between the two countries.
Meeting between Ambassador Godfrey Cooray and Managing Director of Norwegian Lobster Farm

Ambassador Godfrey Cooray met with Asbjøn Drenstig, the Managing Director of Norwegian Lobster Farm, a prominent figure in the lobster farming industry in Norway. Mr. Drenstig is actively engaged in the Sri Lanka-Norway Business match, fostering business relations between the two countries.
Ambassador Meets with the Norwegian Shipowners’ Association

Ambassador Godfrey Cooray met with the Norwegian Shipowners’ Association, where Chief Executive Officer Harald Solberg and Helene Tofte, Director of International Cooperation and Climate, represented the Norwegian shipowners. The meeting aimed to discuss cooperation and climate initiatives within the maritime industry.
Ambassador Gunasekera delivers Key Note address at the Webinar on “Sustainable/eco-Tourism in Archipelagic and Island States Post COVID-19 Pandemic”

Ambassador Gunasekera delivered a keynote address at the Webinar on "Sustainable/Eco-Tourism in Archipelagic and Island States Post COVID-19 Pandemic." The AIS Forum, established on November 1, 2018, in Manado, Indonesia, incorporates several Sustainable Development Goals, including SDG14.
Embassy of Sri Lanka in Jakarta organizes an Online Business Forum

The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Brussels started work in the New Year 2020 with a brief ceremony, where Ambassador Grace Asirwatham hoisted the National Flag followed by singing. The event marked the official commencement of activities for the year.
Embassy in Washington DC commences work in the new year with a firm resolve

The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Washington DC officially started its work in the new year 2020 with a special program at the chancery building on January 2nd. The program commenced with a ceremony, showcasing the embassy's firm resolve for the year ahead.
High Commissioner Girihagama attends religious observances to invoke blessings for the New Year

Sri Lanka’s High Commissioner to Canada, Asoka Girihagama, participated in special religious observances at two Buddhist temples in Ottawa: the Ottawa Buddhist Vihara and Hilda Jayewardenarama, to seek blessings for the New Year.
Commencement of the work year 2020 at Sri Lanka  High Commission in Kuala Lumpur

The work year 2020 at the Sri Lanka High Commission in Kuala Lumpur began with High Commissioner Air Chief Marshal Kapila Veedhiya Bandara hosting the national flag on 01 January 2020. The High Commissioner marked the commencement of the year at the High Commission.

The staff of the Sri Lanka Embassy in Egypt ceremonially started work for 2020 with a special program at the Embassy Premises on January 1st. The program began with a religious observance, marking the beginning of the new year.
Sri Lanka Embassy in Tokyo commenced 2020 with a consular mobile service

The Sri Lanka Embassy in Tokyo kicked off 2020 by offering a consular mobile service at Sawara “Lankaji” Temple in Chiba Prefecture. Approximately 100 Sri Lankan expatriates received various consular services during the event. This initiative aimed to assist and support the Sri Lankan community living in Japan.
Commencement of Work on January 1st at the Sri Lanka High Commission in Canberra
The staff at the Sri Lanka High Commission in Canberra began work on January 1st with a special morning program at the premises. The program marked the commencement of activities for the new year.
Ceremonial Commencement of Work – Year 2020, at the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Bahrain

The staff of the Sri Lanka Embassy in Bahrain ceremonially commenced work for the year 2020 with a special program at the Embassy premises on January 1, 2020. The program marked the beginning of their official duties for the new year.
Commencement of First Working Day, Year – 2020
The first working day of 2020 commenced with an official ceremony at the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Yangon on 01 January 2020, led by Ambassador Nandimithra Ekanayake.
The Commencement of Work Year 2020 at the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Lebanon

The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Lebanon started its work for 2020 with a ceremonial program on January 1, 2020, at the Embassy premises. Ambassador Shani Calyaneratne Karunarat led the commencement ceremony.

The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Mumbai hosted its Annual Christmas Celebrations on December 20, 2019, at the Mission Premises. The event was well-attended by a large gathering of Sri Lankans, including representatives from the Sri Lanka Navy. It was a festive and joyous occasion for all participants.
Sri Lanka is recognized as Asia’s Best Nation for Wildlife Tourism at the Top Asia Corporate Ball 2019

Sri Lanka has been named Asia's Best Nation for Wildlife Tourism at the Top Asia Corporate Ball 2019, as recognized by Top 10 Asia's premier publications. The High Commissioner of Sri Lanka, Kapila Jayampathy, accepted the prestigious award on behalf of the country.
Sri Lanka Embassy in Israel Celebrates Christmas

The Sri Lanka Embassy in Tel Aviv celebrated Christmas on 29 December 2019 with the Sri Lankan community in Israel at the Embassy premises. The event included a gathering led by Rev. Father Harald Leo Meril Peiris from the Diocese of Colombo.

The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Lebanon celebrated Christmas on 29 December 2019 with over 100 migrant workers from the Sri Lankan community. The celebration took place at the Embassy premises, bringing together the migrant workers for a festive event.
